meanings.definition: The act of educating again or differently.
meanings.sent1: After his accident, he underwent reeducations to learn how to walk again.
meanings.sent2: The school offered reeducations to adults who wanted to improve their computer skills.
meanings.sent3: The reeducations on gardening turned out to be more fun than expected.
meanings.sent4: Her journey to self-discovery felt like a series of reeducations on life's possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The reeducations on mindfulness left a lasting impact on her daily routine.

meanings.definition: The process of teaching new skills or ideas to someone who needs to change their beliefs or behavior.
meanings.sent1: The reeducations on healthy eating habits helped him make better food choices.
meanings.sent2: She attended reeducations on conflict resolution to improve her communication skills.
meanings.sent3: The reeducations on time management were surprisingly engaging.
meanings.sent4: His journey to success involved multiple reeducations on leadership.
meanings.sent5: The reeducations on financial literacy opened her eyes to better money management.
